status.name: Closed

fields.description: About half the time, I see a "stop script?" dialog when pulling up policy wizard.

comments.body:
Pull request at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/479

Note that I wasn't able to reproduce the issue in Firefox, Chrome, or Safari.  There are many CLC fetches and loads of DOM to build the policy generator, which will be adversely affected on a slow VPN connection.  We can keep an eye on this for non-VPN connections and can revisit if it surfaces under those conditions.

I find that periodically, I need to restart firefox since it bogs down over time. Perhaps since I've had it up for so long, I see this error more often. Generally, when the request to the back-end takes time, that won't cause this, but if the in-browser rendering takes a lot of time, then we'll see this. I haven't looked at the client processing that's going on for this page, but if there's a loop, breaking the work up and using a timer can get around this.
Just saw this again when I tried to add a policy to a user. As soon as FF tried displaying the policy wizard, I got the "unresponsive script" dialog.

[~dkavanagh]: Looks as though disabling the connection object cache has significantly impacted the policy wizard, esp. since there are so many fetches required for that page.  I'm going to re-enable the connection object cache while working on this ticket, now that we have a safe approach to clear the cache in Beaker 1.5.4.

[~dkavanagh], [~jloza]: Looking at the performance info in the debug toolbar, re-enabling the connection object cache bumps the load time of the Add Policy from over 7 sec down to around 4-5 seconds.  I'm going to open a pull request that re-enables that cache per se to address this. Hopefully this is adequate for 4.0.0, since re-working the Add Policy page this late in the release to optimize performance is fairly risky.  

Somewhat related--the dashboard load time drops from around 5 sec to just over 3 sec with the connection object cache re-enabled, so having the connection cache on is a big win for the dashboard load time.

Pull request at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/568

[~kyolee]: Could we test this branch with a package-based install?  I'd like to test if the cache-clearing approach we're using in this PR is compatible with our modified Beaker 1.5.4 package in an RPM-based install.  If we could test for breakage on login/logout with a package-based console, that would be great.

[~kgill] can you add a loading indicator here, with the animation? I think that would help folks deal with the page taking so long to load, too...I agree we don't want to risk making changes for performance this late in the game if they are high risk. 

We can always improve performance in 4.0.1
The pull request has been merged, and the log in and out has been verified on the latest package installation.

Since we've disabled the connection object cache (and will probably not re-enable it for some time, if ever), the IAM policy generator page will take some time to load due to the sheer number of API calls required to populate the resources and condition choices.  Re-scoping for 4.0.1 to improve performance.

I still see this ever time I run the policy generator. We might have to go the lazy loading route taken on the user pages where sections not immediately visible could be populated from XHR calls once the initial page is loaded.

[~dkavanagh]: Yep, the lazy-loading approach could work.  I experimented with switching the ng-switch statements to ng-if, and performance seems to increase by an order of magnitude -- but the chosen widgets in the advanced section of each policy didn't work with ng-if.  Switching the chosen widgets to use Angular directives may solve that, and we should give it a try for 4.0.1.

Yeah, this page takes waaaaaay too long to load, for sure. May also need to add a loading indicator, possibly. 

Once y'all whip through the current top 10 for 4.0.1 feel free to take this one, [~dkavanagh]! Thanks for your hard work!

The best we can do for now is to add a loading indicator.  Note that the page loads much faster if pyramid_debugtoolbar is disabled and the browser cache is enabled.  The slowness could also be due to a VPN connection.
Pull request for loading indicator at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/800
[~ccassler]: I assigned this to you since you are working on tests for policy wizard.
I tried this quite a few times and wasn't able to reproduce.

There must be something better we can do to improve loading this page. It's unacceptably slow. 

Maybe not front-load so much stuff, load hidden items as they are required for view? Defer loading things until associated accordions are opened perhaps?

I am going to clone this bug for 4.1 to do more work on this, but let's leave this one here so we at least get the loading indicator, even though it seems to freeze it's better than nothing. It's just not enough to solve the problem.
